intro: Barleria dianthera, commonly known as the pink barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink or red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Barleria dianthera thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
